contentrichtext.text: {| align=left border=1 cellpadding=4 cellspacing=0 style="float:right; margin-left: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; background: #ffffff; border: 1px #aaaaaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; text-align:left; font-size: 95%; width: 260px;" |- ! style="background:#f9f9f9; text-align:center;" colspan=2 | Iniö kommun - Iniön kunta |- | colspan=2 style="padding: 0px;" | {| align=center cellspacing=0 cellpadding=3 width=252 |- | align=center width=50% | [[Image:Iniö.vaakuna.svg|100px]] <!--Image width 120px--> | align=center width=50% | [[Image:Iniö.sijainti.suomi.2008.svg|120px]] <!--Image width 120px--> |- | align=center | ''Coat of Arms'' | align=center | ''Location'' |} |- bgcolor=#F9F9F9 | [[Provinces of Finland|Province]] | [[Western Finland]] |- | [[Regions of Finland|Region]] | [[Finland Proper]] |- bgcolor=#F9F9F9 | [[Sub-regions of Finland|Sub-region]] | [[Åboland]] |- | Area<br>- Of which land<br>- Rank | 63.86 km²<br>63.69 km²<br>ranked [[List of Finnish municipalities by area|423rd]] |- bgcolor=#F9F9F9 | Population<br>- Density<br>- Change<br>- Rank | 253 (2004)<br>4.0 inh./km²<br>+ 0.8%<br>ranked [[List of Finnish municipalities by population|428th]] |- | [[Urbanisation]] | 0.0% |- bgcolor=#F9F9F9 | [[Unemployment]] | 5.0% |- | Official languages | [[Swedish language|Swedish]], [[Finnish language|Finnish]] |- bgcolor=#F9F9F9 | [[City Manager|Municipal manager]] | Christjan Brander |- | Home page | [http://www.inio.fi http://www.inio.fi] |} '''Iniö''' is a [[List of former municipalities of Finland|former municipality]] of [[Finland]]. On 1 January 2009, it was consolidated with [[Houtskär]], [[Korpo]], [[Nagu]] and [[Pargas (former municipality)|Pargas]] to form the new town of [[Väståboland]]. It is located in the [[provinces of Finland|province]] of [[Western Finland]] (Länsi-Suomen lääni) and is part of the [[Finland Proper (region)|Finland Proper]] [[regions of Finland|region]]. The municipality had a population of 253 (2004-12-31) and covered an area of 63.86 km² (excluding sea) of which 0.17 km² is inland water. The [[population density]] was 3.97 inhabitants per km². The municipality was [[bilingual]], with majority being [[Finland-Swedish|Swedish]] and minority [[Finnish language|Finnish]] speakers. == External links == {{commonscat-inline}} * [http://www.inio.fi/ Official website] – in Swedish and Finnish {{FinlandProper}} {{coord|60|23|50|N|21|23|10|E|region:FI_type:city(253)_scale:50000|display=title}} [[Category:Populated places disestablished in 2009]] [[Category:Finnish islands in the Baltic]] [[Category:Former municipalities of Finland]] [[Category:Pargas]] {{WesternFinland-geo-stub}}
